description: Everything is built right into it, from documentation to intelligent auto-complete feature.

Constantly improving
Excellent GIT support
You have all tools needed to craft an APK in this one app.
for me : in Linux it Just works man ;)

This appears to work great, EXCEPT on Pixelbooks / Pixel 3. That support "for pushing apps to USB-attached devices is coming later this year." That page was last updated Sep 2018. Unfortunately, due to the hardware Pixelbooks are unable to run virtual devices, and since they currently also cannot debug on USB attached devices this means NO DEVELOPING ON PIXELBOOKS as of now. Hope that changes soon. 

source: https://developer.android.com/topic/arc/studio

Switched to AS when its 1.0 as released as I was having a nightmare with Eclipse. I was running it on Mac back then and Eclipse was crashing around 4 times a day, so when I shifted to AS 1.0 it only crashed less than 5 times in a month.

Anyway, I've heard Windows users ranting against AS, so maybe it (or IntelliJ IDEA) isn't optimized for Windows OS, or maybe Windows OS has unoptimized Java or something.
summary: Great IDE, runs smoother on Linux!

description: es muy buena para programcion de apliciones Android
